# Solution

If you check the RSA public key, you will see that it uses a modulus that was factored in 2009.
```sh
$ openssl rsa -pubin -inform PEM -text -noout < key.pub
RSA Public-Key: (768 bit)
Modulus:
    00:ca:d9:84:55:7c:97:e0:39:43:1a:22:6a:d7:27:
    f0:c6:d4:3e:f3:d4:18:46:9f:1b:37:50:49:b2:29:
    84:3e:e9:f8:3b:1f:97:73:8a:c2:74:f5:f6:1f:40:
    1f:21:f1:91:3e:4b:64:bb:31:b5:5a:38:d3:98:c0:
    df:ed:00:b1:39:2f:08:89:71:1c:44:b3:59:e7:97:
    6c:61:7f:cc:73:4f:06:e3:e9:5c:26:47:60:91:b5:
    2f:46:2e:79:41:3d:b5
Exponent: 65537 (0x10001)
$ python3
Python 3.8.10 (default, Jun  2 2021, 10:49:15) 
[GCC 9.4.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> a="""    00:ca:d9:84:55:7c:97:e0:39:43:1a:22:6a:d7:27:
...     f0:c6:d4:3e:f3:d4:18:46:9f:1b:37:50:49:b2:29:
...     84:3e:e9:f8:3b:1f:97:73:8a:c2:74:f5:f6:1f:40:
...     1f:21:f1:91:3e:4b:64:bb:31:b5:5a:38:d3:98:c0:
...     df:ed:00:b1:39:2f:08:89:71:1c:44:b3:59:e7:97:
...     6c:61:7f:cc:73:4f:06:e3:e9:5c:26:47:60:91:b5:
...     2f:46:2e:79:41:3d:b5
... """.replace(' ','').replace('\n','').replace(':','')
>>> int(a,16)
1230186684530117755130494958384962720772853569595334792197322452151726400507263657518745202199786469389956474942774063845925192557326303453731548268507917026122142913461670429214311602221240479274737794080665351419597459856902143413
```

The factors can be extracted from factordb:
```
33478071698956898786044169848212690817704794983713768568912431388982883793878002287614711652531743087737814467999489

36746043666799590428244633799627952632279158164343087642676032283815739666511279233373417143396810270092798736308917
```

Recreate the private key with either `openssl` or `rsatool.py`:
```sh
$ python3 rsatool.py -n 1230186684530117755130494958384962720772853569595334792197322452151726400507263657518745202199786469389956474942774063845925192557326303453731548268507917026122142913461670429214311602221240479274737794080665351419597459856902143413 -p 33478071698956898786044169848212690817704794983713768568912431388982883793878002287614711652531743087737814467999489 -q 36746043666799590428244633799627952632279158164343087642676032283815739666511279233373417143396810270092798736308917 -e 65537 -o key.pem
Using (p, q) to initialise RSA instance

n =
cad984557c97e039431a226ad727f0c6d43ef3d418469f1b375049b229843ee9f83b1f97738ac274
f5f61f401f21f1913e4b64bb31b55a38d398c0dfed00b1392f0889711c44b359e7976c617fcc734f
06e3e95c26476091b52f462e79413db5

e = 65537 (0x10001)

d =
740de48760442835baad5e1990453a9d16db7976d3f8bb98bf99c0c01cbe9b9c12b808c80683d1e3
46c16c79ac162874f28ca610c1b97e5e1ffae95725ce0c6b031c3e188b17187a793b322cc4004c56
8e76c9b258542ea2a2d6ecd462fff401

p =
d982ec7b440e2869d2535e51f91bacc3eb6eba042e106e6f875c3d17e53db65fffd6e4e9a36084ce
60f83d754dd7f701

q =
eebe6dd23ce7e99c0e2249fecc4418c34af74e418bfa714c3791828414ab18f32fd7e093062a49b0
30225cc845f99ab5

Saving PEM as key.pem
$ cat key.pem
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIBywIBAAJhAMrZhFV8l+A5Qxoiatcn8MbUPvPUGEafGzdQSbIphD7p+Dsfl3OKwnT19h9AHyHx
kT5LZLsxtVo405jA3+0AsTkvCIlxHESzWeeXbGF/zHNPBuPpXCZHYJG1L0YueUE9tQIDAQABAmB0
DeSHYEQoNbqtXhmQRTqdFtt5dtP4u5i/mcDAHL6bnBK4CMgGg9HjRsFseawWKHTyjKYQwbl+Xh/6
6VclzgxrAxw+GIsXGHp5OzIsxABMVo52ybJYVC6iotbs1GL/9AECMQDZgux7RA4oadJTXlH5G6zD
6266BC4Qbm+HXD0X5T22X//W5OmjYITOYPg9dU3X9wECMQDuvm3SPOfpnA4iSf7MRBjDSvdOQYv6
cUw3kYKEFKsY8y/X4JMGKkmwMCJcyEX5mrUCMQCXWi353DJJ1tDe6Bv8TlCah+GlmLEBCAedVgbA
8OhPVl+tBd65q7jd7sXt5glDxQECMQCnEe/8Xc7U9fYWHL4H5+eEUuO5ibkRK1Pw1w0ErQoGzbe/
VFLOz6z9dNG3KBd/0rkCMH6J+q8/eK2Vi+vGXc92zSHplI4rshqBvhCfrDcrtBuu7b38Z1dz+ky1
xc4ZO17bnA==
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
```

Decrypt the `flagrypted` with the private key:
```sh
openssl rsautl -decrypt -inkey key.pem < flagrypted 
The flag for this challenge is ibctf{n33d-4t-l34st_2048_0r-just-us3-3C}
```
